reviews.review_msg: Textbook? Sucks. Prof? Boring and uninteresting. Grading Scheme? Not even really based on interpretation of history. Don't ever take this course, coming from a History major. Way too hard for a 100 Level course. 1.5 hours to write 3 essays. You've got to be joking. Don't ever take during COVID times.
As noted by numerous others lectures are extremely boring, but if you go to tutorials (assuming a good TA) the class itself is fairly easy.  Prepare for a lot of reading though.
Worst Professor I have ever had. Moralizes heavily for no reason. Has a very boring voice. Worst textbooks I have encountered. Marking scheme not really based on history knowledge. Extremely Prudish.
Boring, to the nth degree. Lectures are terribly incoherent and uninteresting. And she marks way to hard considering its a 100 level class. AVOID AT ALL COST.

The textbook was dense, uninteresting, and jumped around. Primary sources were sometimes photocopies of original documents, and were at times indistinguishable from a smudge on the page. Lectures were dry, uninteresting, and mostly reiterated what the textbook said in more depth. I won't be taking another class with her.

not a fun class to take at all. the lectures were really boring and hard to follow, and there were way to many readings to keep up with the lectures in the first place. she seems very unwilling to sypmathize with her students who expressed concerns about the amount of readings. Its a hard course to take at a 100 level..avoid it if you can!!!
Great Teacher. This class was interesting and engaging.
